bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: ① Etiological Agent. of collecting phlegm and stagnant qi, with phlegm and qi striking at each other and blocking passageways. This in turn brings forth all types of pathological conditions. Zhu bing yuan hou lun 諸病源候論 14: 胸膈痰飲多者，嗽則氣動於痰，上搏喉咽之間， 痰氣相擊，隨嗽動息，呼呷有聲，謂之呷嗽 , “If large quantities of phlegm rheum collect in the region of the chest and diaphragm, coughing will make qi move against the phlegm, with the latter rising and striking the region of the throat and gullet. Phlegm and qi strike at each other in accordance with the cough’s being active or dormant. Exhalation has a creaking sound. This is called creaking cough”. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Bai bing zhu zhi yao 百病主治藥 lists the following conditions as brought forth by ‘phlegm qi’: 諸風證 , all types of wind conditions; 諸氣證 , all types of qi conditions; 咳嗽 , cough; 喘逆 , panting with [qi] counterflow; 積聚癥瘕 , accumulation and collection, concretion-illness and conglomeration-illness; 脅痛 , painful flanks; 腰痛 , painful lower back.

② Pathological Condition brought forth by a mutual blockage of phlegm and qi. Xin xiu ben cao 新修本草 Substance Entry sheng jiang 生薑：薑，久服通神明，主風邪，主痰氣 , “ Jiang , if ingested over an extended period of time will brighten the mind. It controls wind evil, and phlegm qi ”.
